content:
Storing batteries in a small plastic container in your junk drawer is a great idea. It's a convenient and organized way to keep them tidy and easily accessible.

I'm glad you're settling into your new apartment, and I'm sure you'll get more comfortable with the kitchen layout as time goes on. It's normal to feel a bit disoriented in a new space, but it's exciting to explore and make it your own.

As for your favorite coffee mug, don't worry! It's easy to misplace items during a move, and it's possible it might still turn up. Keep an eye out for it as you unpack and organize your new space. If you still can't find it, you could always treat yourself to a new one or replace it with a similar one.

Remember, it's all part of the process of settling into a new home. Take your time, and enjoy the journey of making your new space feel like yours.

By the way, have you discovered any favorite spots or features in your new apartment yet? Is there anything you're particularly enjoying about your new kitchen or living space?
